intro: [WRONG START] Tragopopon buphthalmoides var. humilis, commonly known as the dwarf goat's beard, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It features slender, hairy stems that produce yellow flowers with long, slender petals. The plant has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to arid environments and suitable for ecological restoration projects.
